lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Meat.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Meat.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
// Update the title above to match the actual product name
// Describe the action and its outcome.
// A description of the expected outcome goes here
* Initializes storage, task list, UI, and parser, then
* runs a loop until the user exits with "bye".
Parser parser = new Parser(ui, taskList, storage);
String input = scanner.nextLine(); //entire line of input
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");

* Parses and validates user input commands for tasks.

* Constructs a Parser with the specified Ui, Tasklist, and Storage.
* @param ui the Ui object for displaying messages
* @param taskList the Tasklist object for managing tasks
* @param storage the Storage object for file operations
public Parser(Ui ui, Tasklist taskList, Storage storage) {

* Represents a task with a deadline.
* Extends Todo by adding an end date and time.
/** The end date and time of the deadline. */
* Constructs a Deadline with a name and end date/time.
* @param name the name of the task
* @param end  the LocalDateTime representing the deadline
* Returns the end date and time formatted as "dd.MM.yyyy HH:mm".
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline, with its
* type, marked status, name, and formatted end date/time.
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline for file storage.
* Represents a task that occurs over a period of time.
* Extends Deadline by adding a start date and time.
/** The start date and time of the event. */
* Constructs an Event with a name, end date/time, and start date/time.
* @param name  the name of the event
* @param end   the LocalDateTime representing the end of the event
* @param start the LocalDateTime representing the start of the event
public Event(String name, LocalDateTime end, LocalDateTime start) {
* Returns the start date and time formatted as "dd.MM.yyyy HH:mm".
* Returns a string representation of the Event, with its
* type, marked status, name, start, and end date/time.
return Type() + Marked() + " " + Name() + "(from: " + this.Start() + " " + "to: " + End() + ")";
* Returns a string representation of the Event for file storage.
return Type() + "|" + Marked() + "|" + Name() + "|" + End() + "|" + this.Start();
